trans-unit.source: Represents the distinguished name of an X509 certificate.
This class cannot be inherited.

This class is like an extension to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2.SubjectName%2A> or <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2.IssuerName%2A> property, which is the name of the person or entity that the certificate is being issued to.
X.500 is an international standard for distributed directory services.

The distinguished name uses the following format: [X500:/C=CountryCode/O=Organization/OU=OrganizationUnit/CN=CommonName] The following field length limits apply: |Field|Length Limit| |-----------|------------------| |CountryCode|2 characters| |Organization|Up to 64 characters| |OrganizationUnit|Up to 32 characters| |CommonName|Up to 64 characters| The following guidelines apply: - Field values can be uppercase or lowercase.
- Delimiters are slash marks (/) and must appear before the first value and between subsequent values.
- Delimiters can be followed by a space.
The following is an example of a correctly formatted name: [X500:/ C=US/ O=Microsoft/ OU=WGA/ CN=TedSt]
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X500DistinguishedName"></xref> class using information from the specified byte array.
The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X500DistinguishedName> class inherits from the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.AsnEncodedData> class.
A byte array that contains distinguished name information.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X500DistinguishedName"></xref> class using the specified <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.AsnEncodedData"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X500DistinguishedName> class inherits from the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.AsnEncodedData> class.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.AsnEncodedData"></xref> object that represents the distinguished name.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X500DistinguishedName"></xref> class using the specified <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X500DistinguishedName"></xref> object.
This constructor creates a copy of the specified <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X500DistinguishedName> object.
The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X500DistinguishedName> class inherits from the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.AsnEncodedData> class.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X500DistinguishedName"></xref> object.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X500DistinguishedName"></xref> class using information from the specified string.
The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X500DistinguishedName> class inherits from the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.AsnEncodedData> class.
A string that represents the distinguished name.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X500DistinguishedName"></xref> class using the specified string and <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X500DistinguishedNameFlags"></xref> flag.
The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X500DistinguishedName> class inherits from the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.AsnEncodedData> class.
A string that represents the distinguished name.
A bitwise combination of the enumeration values that specify the characteristics of the distinguished name.
Decodes a distinguished name using the characteristics specified by the flag parameter.
This method decodes the ASN encoded distinguished name into a string value.
A bitwise combination of the enumeration values that specify the characteristics of the distinguished name.
The decoded distinguished name.
The certificate has an invalid name.
Returns a formatted version of an X500 distinguished name for printing or for output to a text window or to a console.
Use this method to print Abstract Syntax Notation number One (ASN.1)-encoded data or output the information to a text box.
Use the `multiLine` parameter to control the layout of the output.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the return string should contain carriage returns; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
A formatted string that represents the X500 distinguished name.
Gets the comma-delimited distinguished name from an X500 certificate.
The distinguished name uses the following format: [X500:/C=CountryCode/O=Organization/OU=OrganizationUnit/CN=CommonName]
The comma-delimited distinguished name of the X509 certificate.
